title: The Scapegoat Loop
story_summary: In the tightly controlled city of Stenograd, Marek Halden reigned as the architect behind the Behavioral Compliance Index, a vast system quietly judging every citizen's life and choices. As his power grew, Halden locked down access, centralized authority, and made changes in secret - until, without warning, he was found dead in his sealed residence. The heart of the city's order skipped a beat: automated systems glitched, privileges vanished, and suspicion filled the vacuum left by Halden's absence. Desperate for control, Council factions feuded while technician Oksana Lintz rushed a quick fix, not knowing it would open the floodgates. Soon, a massive leak exposed private BCI scores and officials' secrets, igniting public fury and widespread unrest. As the city convulsed with protests and chaos, hidden records emerged, proving that the seeds of Stenograd's collapse had been sown by Halden long before his mysterious death.

official.headline: Service Optimization
official.anchor_line: City kiosks update as Behavioral Compliance Index adjusts scores for greater accuracy.
official.contextual_reframing: Temporary service recalibration ensures fair access for all residents. The BCI - a citywide system measuring compliance - works to streamline daily life.

official.headline: Peaceful Demonstrations
official.anchor_line: Public demonstrations in select districts as residents experience brief score fluctuations.
official.contextual_reframing: Orderly civic response reflects Stenograd's open commitment to continuous improvement. The BCI adapts in real time for the collective good.

official.headline: Council Reaffirms Unity
official.anchor_line: Stenograd's Council confirms its commitment to transparent system enhancements.
official.contextual_reframing: Officials emphasize rational leadership and the resilience of automated governance. Ongoing improvements keep Stenograd efficient, secure, and stable.

underground.headline: BCI Glitch Wrecks Lives
underground.anchor_line: Score chaos in old pilot zones means services suddenly vanish for thousands.
underground.contextual_reframing: The Behavioral Compliance Index, known as BCI, is supposed to measure your 'safety' - instead it's locking out entire neighborhoods. This is what algorithmic control looks like on the ground.

underground.headline: Lintz Set Up?
underground.anchor_line: Top engineer Oksana Lintz takes the blame for a system crash she didn't cause.
underground.contextual_reframing: Leaked reports show the BCI was screwed up before Lintz touched it, but the Council needed a scapegoat. In Stenograd, no one gets real answers - just another name erased.

underground.headline: No Stability Here
underground.anchor_line: Violent protests erupt as the system freezes out citizens with low scores.
underground.contextual_reframing: When the only way to eat, work, or move is a number, everyone is trapped. The BCI and Council run Stenograd like a machine - and the people are breaking down.

belief_a.belief: Truth, no matter how painful, empowers people to demand change.

belief_a.belief: Reporting clear injustice is the only way to hold power accountable.

challenging_response: But what's it cost if the Council lashes out twice as hard - can you still call that justice?

belief_a.belief: Shining light on algorithmic cruelty exposes the system's moral bankruptcy.
monologue: We talk code and efficiency, but it's just engineered cruelty hidden in numbers.

supportive_response: Calling it out strips away their mask - people need to see what they're serving up.

belief_b.belief: Myths spark movements where facts are suppressed or dangerous.
monologue: People in this city cling to stories when the truth puts them in danger.

You can strangle a report, but legends breathe in places the system can't reach.
supportive_response: You're right - myth has kept people alive here longer than facts ever did.
Let's see where this story goes next, if you're willing to share more.
challenging_response: Legends can twist, Rada, and fear spreads faster in shadow than light.
Maybe this city needs hard truth, not another story - what else are you thinking?

belief_b.belief: An enigma can unify people against the system through hope and unease.
monologue: When the system has all the answers, maybe it's questions that bring people together.
A mystery draws more eyes than a headline, especially if hope is mixed in the fog.
It's harder to silence a crowd when they're united by the unknown.
supportive_response: A question with no answer gets everyone talking, even here in Stenograd.
You've got me curious now - keep going, what does that mystery look like?
challenging_response: But an enigma can just as easily split us, keep us guessing and distrustful.
Maybe unity comes from sharing what we know - not what we can't pin down. What else drives you?

belief_b.belief: Letting legend speak invites citizens to interpret and resist in their own way.
monologue: People don't need a script - they need space to shape resistance with their own meaning.
Legends grow wild, reach corners where official stories never land.
Handing over the myth means trusting people to act, even if it looks risky.
supportive_response: That trust is rare around here - you might be giving them something powerful.
I wonder what kind of resistance will show up if you let the myth breathe?
challenging_response: But if everyone interprets the legend differently, what if it all just fizzles out?
Maybe people need you to guide them, not just hand over the story. Tell me more.

I used to believe in all this - predictability, alignment, harmony. Not fear. We called ourselves Harmonists for a reason.

Lintz is an easy mark. As soon as scoring failed publicly, they hung it on her and revoked her access. But internal files I saw prove Halden made the reckless changes they're now hiding.
Council divided - Harmonists want to quiet things, Directorate clamps down, Innovators push new code. Nobody agrees.
The information loss is so severe, some routines are guessing. Wild score swings aren't a bug - they're a sign nobody's steering.

But what's happening isn't harmony. It's control slipping - quietly, and maybe for good.
